reviewText:
Early Access Review

Super Cane Magic Zero is a zany roguelike featuring the hilarious (and quite famous) Italian comic book artist, Sio. For example, learn to count with John the Toilet":
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m5j_rGENhmA
Now Studio Evil and Sio are teaming up to bring this wacko comic style to the action rpg/roguelike genre.

I've watched these guys build this game from afar for a long time
recommended: through their Kickstarter (Italian only) and now on Steam Early Access.\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qUbntiHB-sU\nYou move around. You pick up anything. You can throw those things. Or eat those things. Depending what you eat and what you "believe"
hoursPlayed: your abilities change. The art style is hilarious
voteText: with parrot-heads moving around on wheels
votesFunny: pirate hates and lots of strange elements.\n\nWhile it's still early access
commentsCount: it's also really coming together into a unique
column17: almost party-like game. If you like local co-op games like Castle Crashers and/or unique beautiful 2D art games like Binding of Isaac or anything Nintendoish
column18: you might just love Super Cane.\n\nIt's already fun and funny and I can't wait to see where they go with it. Recommended!"
column22: 52 of 61 people (85%) found this review helpful 14 people found this review funny

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nEven in its current early access" state the game shows a lot of promise. The art is very nice and so is the music and the humor. I can't wait to see what they come up with in the story mode
date: but throwing stuff around in local multiplayer is already a lot of fun!"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This preview is based on Build 6.

It's kind of hard to explain what type of game Super Cane Magic ZERO is. It's kind of like a top down RPG since you can gather armor and other items to equip. The game also kind of plays like an action game where you and your buddies run around the screen throwing items at the enemies trying to kill them.

At this time the game is kind of early in development, lacking some of the features of the final game including the campaign. The game does already shows promise though. For some reason it is fun just to run around the screen throwing random items at enemies. The game already looks like it will be a fun multiplayer experience. I am interested in seeing what the game ends up doing with the campaign mode since the artwork is already quirky and I think the game could be funny if enough time is put into the game's story.

Note: I received a free review copy of Super Cane Magic ZERO. Other than the review copy I received no other compensation for this review and receiving the free copy had no effect on the contents of this review.

Read My Full Review [www.geekyhobbies.com]

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A Comedic Mutliplayer Arcade Action RPGhttps://youtu.be/7nK_PXdPOR4
+ Absolutely fantastic art style / graphics, everything looks a bit cartoony and really enjoyable to look at
+ Really comical characters, and some quite funny dialogue
+ Up to 4-player co-op or battle it out in the arena (I highly recommend playing with at least 1 other person)
+ Fun gameplay filled a ton of loot, interesting enemies, and bosses
+ The challenge mode seems like a great game in itself, while there's a Story mode" coming later which should add a load of content

This game is in Early Access so don't take these too seriously
- Sometimes it's hard to tell what exactly you are picking up which can be a problem as if you eat certain items they can damage you or even explode causing you to easily lose a life
- I felt like the game was designed for multiple players so if you end up playing by yourself it can be a bit challenging and slow to progress as enemies tend to do a lot of damage. (I'd recommend easy mode)"

This game is stupid and awesome, I'm having a lot of fun playing it with friends.

Everything is super silly and you will probably hit your friends more often than you hit your enemies.
Sometimes on purpose.

A nice touch also is the silliness of the menus? Like, there's no Quit" button

Early Access Review

https://youtu.be/SJ6t-RF1nXE

This game is awesome. Each time you play, even if you do the same challenge, the level changes. This adds a lot of replay value - plus there are tons of items to find and attempt to eat (even if its just to see how the item affects you) The game itself is super fun to play with friends! You and your team can go into this dungeon, talk to unique and quirky characters, before trying to figured out puzzles to get to the next room. The amount of loot, monsters, foods, and characters in this game is impressive. Well worth the money.
